answers.author: Sarah Baker
answers.text:
Hi Jennifer. 
We have have some policies. The big one is that you have to request, approved and trained before you use social media. The training really covers all the guidance in acceptable use and making good decisions. For archiving, we have been very happy with Archive Social. Wake County was any early user and the team has been good to work with.

answers.author: Alix Bowman
answers.text:
Good morning, Jennifer.
Full disclosure, I work for a company in Durham called ArchiveSocial and we help a number of municipalities in North Carolina and other states with social media archiving (including Cary, Durham, Wake County, and the State of NC itself). 
In speaking to governments across the country, we have seen   approaches that range from manual screen capture, to email style backup, to full automation. We would happy to discuss the details of each method with you if you'd like. 
We have a number of free resources available on our website (archivesocial.com) including a social media policy template for public agencies that includes best practices from across the country. We also offer a page of North Carolina specific resources on the topic of public records laws and social media archiving: archivesocial.com/social-media-records-north-carolina
Please don't hesitate to reach out to me (alix.bowman@archivesocial), or Adam Tury on our sales team (adam@archivesocial.com) with questions.
Cheers,
Alix

answers.author: Melanie  Cooper
answers.text:
We do our own archiving for now. Twitter has made archiving entirely simple by adding an archival feature inside the settings panel. We archive Facebook using the following procedure: 
Login into Facebook page needing to be archived
(https://www.facebook.com/[your-page-name])
Append the following to end of URL: 
/timeline/2014/5
The last number (ie. 5) represents the month to be archived.
Expand posts and comments. 
Save as (webpage, complete) to archive folder
Not sure if that helps. I will be interested to read how others are handling this requirement. 
Melanie

author: Jenifer Della Valle
text:
I am helping to draft a social media policy for the Town of Hillsborough. One component of the policy deals with archiving social media records. I would like to know what other local governments are using to archive their data, whether it is a paid service, and any advantages or disadvantages of the method chosen. Thanks in advance!
Jenifer Della Valle
Jen.DellaValle@hillsboroughnc.org
title: Social Media Archiving
